t: Mark 1
The*p beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God;
As*p it is written in the prophets, Behold, I send my messenger before thy face, which shall prepare thy way before thee.
The*p voice of one crying in the wilderness, Prepare ye the way of the Lord, make his paths straight.
John*p did baptize in the wilderness, and preach the baptism of repentance for the remission of sins.
And*p there went out unto him all the land of Judaea, and they of Jerusalem, and were all baptized of him in the river of Jordan, confessing their sins.
And*p John was clothed with camel's hair, and with a girdle of a skin about his loins; and he did eat locusts and wild honey;
And*p preached, saying, There cometh one mightier than I after me, the latchet of whose shoes I am not worthy to stoop down and unloose.
I*p indeed have baptized you with water: but he shall baptize you with the Holy Ghost.
And*p it came to pass in those days, that Jesus came from Nazareth of Galilee, and was baptized of John in Jordan.
And*p straightway coming up out of the water, he saw the heavens opened, and the Spirit like a dove descending upon him:
And*p there came a voice from heaven, saying, Thou art my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased.
And*p immediately the Spirit driveth him into the wilderness.
And*p he was there in the wilderness forty days, tempted of Satan; and was with the wild beasts; and the angels ministered unto him.
Now*p after that John was put in prison, Jesus came into Galilee, preaching the gospel of the kingdom of God,
And*p saying, The*r time*r is*r fulfilled,*r and*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r at*r hand:*r repent*r ye,*r and*r believe*r the*r gospel.*r
Now*p as he walked by the sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers.
And*p Jesus said unto them, Come*r ye*r after*r me,*r and*r I*r will*r make*r you*r to*r become*r fishers*r of*r men.*r
And*p straightway they forsook their nets, and followed him.
And*p when he had gone a little further thence, he saw James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, who also were in the ship mending their nets.
And*p straightway he called them: and they left their father Zebedee in the ship with the hired servants, and went after him.
And*p they went into Capernaum; and straightway on the sabbath day he entered into the synagogue, and taught.
And*p they were astonished at his doctrine: for he taught them as one that had authority, and not as the scribes.
And*p there was in their synagogue a man with an unclean spirit; and he cried out,
Saying,*p Let us alone; what have we to do with thee, thou Jesus of Nazareth? art thou come to destroy us? I know thee who thou art, the Holy One of God.
And*p Jesus rebuked him, saying, Hold*r thy*r peace,*r and*r come*r out*r of*r him.*r
And*p when the unclean spirit had torn him, and cried with a loud voice, he came out of him.

And*p they were all amazed, insomuch that they questioned among themselves, saying, What thing is this? what new doctrine is this? for with authority commandeth he even the unclean spirits, and they do obey him.
And*p immediately his fame spread abroad throughout all the region round about Galilee.
And*p forthwith, when they were come out of the synagogue, they entered into the house of Simon and Andrew, with James and John.
But*p Simon's wife's mother lay sick of a fever, and anon they tell him of her.
And*p he came and took her by the hand, and lifted her up; and immediately the fever left her, and she ministered unto them.
And*p at even, when the sun did set, they brought unto him all that were diseased, and them that were possessed with devils.
And*p all the city was gathered together at the door.
And*p he healed many that were sick of divers diseases, and cast out many devils; and suffered not the devils to speak, because they knew him.
And*p in the morning, rising up a great while before day, he went out, and departed into a solitary place, and there prayed.
And*p Simon and they that were with him followed after him.
And*p when they had found him, they said unto him, All men seek for thee.
And*p he said unto them, Let*r us*r go*r into*r the*r next*r towns,*r that*r I*r may*r preach*r there*r also:*r for*r therefore*r came*r I*r forth.*r
And*p he preached in their synagogues throughout all Galilee, and cast out devils.
And*p there came a leper to him, beseeching him, and kneeling down to him, and saying unto him, If thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.
And*p Jesus, moved with compassion, put forth his hand, and touched him, and saith unto him, I*r will;*r be*r thou*r clean.*r
And*p as soon as he had spoken, immediately the leprosy departed from him, and he was cleansed.
And*p he straitly charged him, and forthwith sent him away;

And*p saith unto him, See*r thou*r say*r nothing*r to*r any*r man:*r but*r go*r thy*r way,*r shew*r thyself*r to*r the*r priest,*r and*r offer*r for*r thy*r cleansing*r those*r things*r which*r Moses*r commanded,*r for*r a*r testimony*r unto*r them.*r

But*p he went out, and began to publish it much, and to blaze abroad the matter, insomuch that Jesus could no more openly enter into the city, but was without in desert places: and they came to him from every quarter.
Mark 2
And*p again he entered into Capernaum after some days; and it was noised that he was in the house.
And*p straightway many were gathered together, insomuch that there was no room to receive them, no, not so much as about the door: and he preached the word unto them.
And*p they come unto him, bringing one sick of the palsy, which was borne of four.
And*p when they could not come nigh unto him for the press, they uncovered the roof where he was: and when they had broken it up, they let down the bed wherein the sick of the palsy lay.
When*p Jesus saw their faith, he said unto the sick of the palsy, Son,*r thy*r sins*r be*r forgiven*r thee.*r
But*p there were certain of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,
Why*p doth this man thus speak blasphemies? who can forgive sins but God only?
And*p immediately when Jesus perceived in his spirit that they so reasoned within themselves, he said unto them, Why*r reason*r ye*r these*r things*r in*r your*r hearts?*r
Whether*rp is*r it*r easier*r to*r say*r to*r the*r sick*r of*r the*r palsy,*r Thy*r sins*r be*r forgiven*r thee;*r or*r to*r say,*r Arise,*r and*r take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk?*r
But*rp that*r ye*r may*r know*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r hath*r power*r on*r earth*r to*r forgive*r sins,*r (he saith to the sick of the palsy,)
I*rp say*r unto*r thee,*r Arise,*r and*r take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r go*r thy*r way*r into*r thine*r house.*r
And*p immediately he arose, took up the bed, and went forth before them all; insomuch that they were all amazed, and glorified God, saying, We never saw it on this fashion.
And*p he went forth again by the sea side; and all the multitude resorted unto him, and he taught them.
And*p as he passed by, he saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting at the receipt of custom, and said unto him, Follow*r me.*r And he arose and followed him.
And*p it came to pass, that, as Jesus sat at meat in his house, many publicans and sinners sat also together with Jesus and his disciples: for there were many, and they followed him.
And*p when the scribes and Pharisees saw him eat with publicans and sinners, they said unto his disciples, How is it that he eateth and drinketh with publicans and sinners?

When*p Jesus heard it, he saith unto them, They*r that*r are*r whole*r have*r no*r need*r of*r the*r physician,*r but*r they*r that*r are*r sick:*r I*r came*r not*r to*r call*r the*r righteous,*r but*r sinners*r to*r repentance.*r
And*p the disciples of John and of the Pharisees used to fast: and they come and say unto him, Why do the disciples of John and of the Pharisees fast, but thy disciples fast not?

And*p Jesus said unto them, Can*r the*r children*r of*r the*r bridechamber*r fast,*r while*r the*r bridegroom*r is*r with*r them?*r as*r long*r as*r they*r have*r the*r bridegroom*r with*r them,*r they*r cannot*r fast.*r
But*rp the*r days*r will*r come,*r when*r the*r bridegroom*r shall*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r them,*r and*r then*r shall*r they*r fast*r in*r those*r days.*r

No*rp man*r also*r seweth*r a*r piece*r of*r new*r cloth*r on*r an*r old*r garment:*r else*r the*r new*r piece*r that*r filled*r it*r up*r taketh*r away*r from*r the*r old,*r and*r the*r rent*r is*r made*r worse.*r

And*rp no*r man*r putteth*r new*r wine*r into*r old*r bottles:*r else*r the*r new*r wine*r doth*r burst*r the*r bottles,*r and*r the*r wine*r is*r spilled,*r and*r the*r bottles*r will*r be*r marred:*r but*r new*r wine*r must*r be*r put*r into*r new*r bottles.*r
And*p it came to pass, that he went through the corn fields on the sabbath day; and his disciples began, as they went, to pluck the ears of corn.
And*p the Pharisees said unto him, Behold, why do they on the sabbath day that which is not lawful?
And*p he said unto them, Have*r ye*r never*r read*r what*r David*r did,*r when*r he*r had*r need,*r and*r was*r an*r hungred,*r he,*r and*r they*r that*r were*r with*r him?*r

How*rp he*r went*r into*r the*r house*r of*r God*r in*r the*r days*r of*r Abiathar*r the*r high*r priest,*r and*r did*r eat*r the*r shewbread,*r which*r is*r not*r lawful*r to*r eat*r but*r for*r the*r priests,*r and*r gave*r also*r to*r them*r which*r were*r with*r him?*r
And*p he said unto them, The*r sabbath*r was*r made*r for*r man,*r and*r not*r man*r for*r the*r sabbath:*r
Therefore*rp the*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r Lord*r also*r of*r the*r sabbath.*r
Mark 3
And*p he entered again into the synagogue; and there was a man there which had a withered hand.
And*p they watched him, whether he would heal him on the sabbath day; that they might accuse him.
And*p he saith unto the man which had the withered hand, Stand*r forth.*r
And*p he saith unto them, Is*r it*r lawful*r to*r do*r good*r on*r the*r sabbath*r days,*r or*r to*r do*r evil?*r to*r save*r life,*r or*r to*r kill?*r But they held their peace.

And*p when he had looked round about on them with anger, being grieved for the hardness of their hearts, he saith unto the man, Stretch*r forth*r thine*r hand.*r And he stretched it out: and his hand was restored whole as the other.
And*p the Pharisees went forth, and straightway took counsel with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.
But*p Jesus withdrew himself with his disciples to the sea: and a great multitude from Galilee followed him, and from Judaea,
And*p from Jerusalem, and from Idumaea, and from beyond Jordan; and they about Tyre and Sidon, a great multitude, when they had heard what great things he did, came unto him.
And*p he spake to his disciples, that a small ship should wait on him because of the multitude, lest they should throng him.
For*p he had healed many; insomuch that they pressed upon him for to touch him, as many as had plagues.
And*p unclean spirits, when they saw him, fell down before him, and cried, saying, Thou art the Son of God.
And*p he straitly charged them that they should not make him known.
And*p he goeth up into a mountain, and calleth unto him whom he would: and they came unto him.
And*p he ordained twelve, that they should be with him, and that he might send them forth to preach,
And*p to have power to heal sicknesses, and to cast out devils:
And*p Simon he surnamed Peter;
And*p James the son of Zebedee, and John the brother of James; and he surnamed them Boanerges, which is, The sons of thunder:
And*p Andrew, and Philip, and Bartholomew, and Matthew, and Thomas, and James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus, and Simon the Canaanite,
And*p Judas Iscariot, which also betrayed him: and they went into an house.
And*p the multitude cometh together again, so that they could not so much as eat bread.
And*p when his friends heard of it, they went out to lay hold on him: for they said, He is beside himself.
And*p the scribes which came down from Jerusalem said, He hath Beelzebub, and by the prince of the devils casteth he out devils.
And*p he called them unto him, and said unto them in parables, How*r can*r Satan*r cast*r out*r Satan?*r
And*rp if*r a*r kingdom*r be*r divided*r against*r itself,*r that*r kingdom*r cannot*r stand.*r
And*rp if*r a*r house*r be*r divided*r against*r itself,*r that*r house*r cannot*r stand.*r
And*rp if*r Satan*r rise*r up*r against*r himself,*r and*r be*r divided,*r he*r cannot*r stand,*r but*r hath*r an*r end.*r
No*rp man*r can*r enter*r into*r a*r strong*r man's*r house,*r and*r spoil*r his*r goods,*r except*r he*r will*r first*r bind*r the*r strong*r man;*r and*r then*r he*r will*r spoil*r his*r house.*r
Verily*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r All*r sins*r shall*r be*r forgiven*r unto*r the*r sons*r of*r men,*r and*r blasphemies*r wherewith*r soever*r they*r shall*r blaspheme:*r
But*rp he*r that*r shall*r blaspheme*r against*r the*r Holy*r Ghost*r hath*r never*r forgiveness,*r but*r is*r in*r danger*r of*r eternal*r damnation:*r
Because*p they said, He hath an unclean spirit.
There*p came then his brethren and his mother, and, standing without, sent unto him, calling him.
And*p the multitude sat about him, and they said unto him, Behold, thy mother and thy brethren without seek for thee.
And*p he answered them, saying, Who*r is*r my*r mother,*r or*r my*r brethren?*r
And*p he looked round about on them which sat about him, and said, Behold*r my*r mother*r and*r my*r brethren!*r
For*rp whosoever*r shall*r do*r the*r will*r of*r God,*r the*r same*r is*r my*r brother,*r and*r my*r sister,*r and*r mother.*r
Mark 4

And*p he began again to teach by the sea side: and there was gathered unto him a great multitude, so that he entered into a ship, and sat in the sea; and the whole multitude was by the sea on the land.
And*p he taught them many things by parables, and said unto them in his doctrine,
Hearken;*rp Behold,*r there*r went*r out*r a*r sower*r to*r sow:*r
And*rp it*r came*r to*r pass,*r as*r he*r sowed,*r some*r fell*r by*r the*r way*r side,*r and*r the*r fowls*r of*r the*r air*r came*r and*r devoured*r it*r up.*r
And*rp some*r fell*r on*r stony*r ground,*r where*r it*r had*r not*r much*r earth;*r and*r immediately*r it*r sprang*r up,*r because*r it*r had*r no*r depth*r of*r earth:*r
But*rp when*r the*r sun*r was*r up,*r it*r was*r scorched;*r and*r because*r it*r had*r no*r root,*r it*r withered*r away.*r
And*rp some*r fell*r among*r thorns,*r and*r the*r thorns*r grew*r up,*r and*r choked*r it,*r and*r it*r yielded*r no*r fruit.*r

And*rp other*r fell*r on*r good*r ground,*r and*r did*r yield*r fruit*r that*r sprang*r up*r and*r increased;*r and*r brought*r forth,*r some*r thirty,*r and*r some*r sixty,*r and*r some*r an*r hundred.*r
And*p he said unto them, He*r that*r hath*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
And*p when he was alone, they that were about him with the twelve asked of him the parable.

And*p he said unto them, Unto*r you*r it*r is*r given*r to*r know*r the*r mystery*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God:*r but*r unto*r them*r that*r are*r without,*r all*r these*r things*r are*r done*r in*r parables:*r

That*rp seeing*r they*r may*r see,*r and*r not*r perceive;*r and*r hearing*r they*r may*r hear,*r and*r not*r understand;*r lest*r at*r any*r time*r they*r should*r be*r converted,*r and*r their*r sins*r should*r be*r forgiven*r them.*r
And*p he said unto them, Know*r ye*r not*r this*r parable?*r and*r how*r then*r will*r ye*r know*r all*r parables?*r
The*rp sower*r soweth*r the*r word.*r

And*rp these*r are*r they*r by*r the*r way*r side,*r where*r the*r word*r is*r sown;*r but*r when*r they*r have*r heard,*r Satan*r cometh*r immediately,*r and*r taketh*r away*r the*r word*r that*r was*r sown*r in*r their*r hearts.*r
And*rp these*r are*r they*r likewise*r which*r are*r sown*r on*r stony*r ground;*r who,*r when*r they*r have*r heard*r the*r word,*r immediately*r receive*r it*r with*r gladness;*r

And*rp have*r no*r root*r in*r themselves,*r and*r so*r endure*r but*r for*r a*r time:*r afterward,*r when*r affliction*r or*r persecution*r ariseth*r for*r the*r word's*r sake,*r immediately*r they*r are*r offended.*r
And*rp these*r are*r they*r which*r are*r sown*r among*r thorns;*r such*r as*r hear*r the*r word,*r

And*rp the*r cares*r of*r this*r world,*r and*r the*r deceitfulness*r of*r riches,*r and*r the*r lusts*r of*r other*r things*r entering*r in,*r choke*r the*r word,*r and*r it*r becometh*r unfruitful.*r

And*rp these*r are*r they*r which*r are*r sown*r on*r good*r ground;*r such*r as*r hear*r the*r word,*r and*r receive*r it,*r and*r bring*r forth*r fruit,*r some*r thirtyfold,*r some*r sixty,*r and*r some*r an*r hundred.*r
And*p he said unto them, Is*r a*r candle*r brought*r to*r be*r put*r under*r a*r bushel,*r or*r under*r a*r bed?*r and*r not*r to*r be*r set*r on*r a*r candlestick?*r
For*rp there*r is*r nothing*r hid,*r which*r shall*r not*r be*r manifested;*r neither*r was*r any*r thing*r kept*r secret,*r but*r that*r it*r should*r come*r abroad.*r
If*rp any*r man*r have*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
And*p he said unto them, Take*r heed*r what*r ye*r hear:*r with*r what*r measure*r ye*r mete,*r it*r shall*r be*r measured*r to*r you:*r and*r unto*r you*r that*r hear*r shall*r more*r be*r given.*r
For*rp he*r that*r hath,*r to*r him*r shall*r be*r given:*r and*r he*r that*r hath*r not,*r from*r him*r shall*r be*r taken*r even*r that*r which*r he*r hath.*r
And*p he said, So*r is*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God,*r as*r if*r a*r man*r should*r cast*r seed*r into*r the*r ground;*r
And*rp should*r sleep,*r and*r rise*r night*r and*r day,*r and*r the*r seed*r should*r spring*r and*r grow*r up,*r he*r knoweth*r not*r how.*r
For*rp the*r earth*r bringeth*r forth*r fruit*r of*r herself;*r first*r the*r blade,*r then*r the*r ear,*r after*r that*r the*r full*r corn*r in*r the*r ear.*r
But*rp when*r the*r fruit*r is*r brought*r forth,*r immediately*r he*r putteth*r in*r the*r sickle,*r because*r the*r harvest*r is*r come.*r
And*p he said, Whereunto*r shall*r we*r liken*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God?*r or*r with*r what*r comparison*r shall*r we*r compare*r it?*r
It*rp is*r like*r a*r grain*r of*r mustard*r seed,*r which,*r when*r it*r is*r sown*r in*r the*r earth,*r is*r less*r than*r all*r the*r seeds*r that*r be*r in*r the*r earth:*r

But*rp when*r it*r is*r sown,*r it*r groweth*r up,*r and*r becometh*r greater*r than*r all*r herbs,*r and*r shooteth*r out*r great*r branches;*r so*r that*r the*r fowls*r of*r the*r air*r may*r lodge*r under*r the*r shadow*r of*r it.*r
And*p with many such parables spake he the word unto them, as they were able to hear it.
But*p without a parable spake he not unto them: and when they were alone, he expounded all things to his disciples.
And*p the same day, when the even was come, he saith unto them, Let*r us*r pass*r over*r unto*r the*r other*r side.*r
And*p when they had sent away the multitude, they took him even as he was in the ship. And there were also with him other little ships.
And*p there arose a great storm of wind, and the waves beat into the ship, so that it was now full.
And*p he was in the hinder part of the ship, asleep on a pillow: and they awake him, and say unto him, Master, carest thou not that we perish?
And*p he arose, and rebuked the wind, and said unto the sea, Peace,*r be*r still.*r And the wind ceased, and there was a great calm.
And*p he said unto them, Why*r are*r ye*r so*r fearful?*r how*r is*r it*r that*r ye*r have*r no*r faith?*r
And*p they feared exceedingly, and said one to another, What manner of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?
Mark 5
And*p they came over unto the other side of the sea, into the country of the Gadarenes.
And*p when he was come out of the ship, immediately there met him out of the tombs a man with an unclean spirit,
Who*p had his dwelling among the tombs; and no man could bind him, no, not with chains:
Because*p that he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been plucked asunder by him, and the fetters broken in pieces: neither could any man tame him.
And*p always, night and day, he was in the mountains, and in the tombs, crying, and cutting himself with stones.
But*p when he saw Jesus afar off, he ran and worshipped him,
And*p cried with a loud voice, and said, What have I to do with thee, Jesus, thou Son of the most high God? I adjure thee by God, that thou torment me not.
For*p he said unto him, Come*r out*r of*r the*r man,*r thou*r unclean*r spirit.*r
And*p he asked him, What*r is*r thy*r name?*r And he answered, saying, My name is Legion: for we are many.
And*p he besought him much that he would not send them away out of the country.
Now*p there was there nigh unto the mountains a great herd of swine feeding.
And*p all the devils besought him, saying, Send us into the swine, that we may enter into them.

And*p forthwith Jesus gave them leave. And the unclean spirits went out, and entered into the swine: and the herd ran violently down a steep place into the sea, (they were about two thousand;) and were choked in the sea.
And*p they that fed the swine fled, and told it in the city, and in the country. And they went out to see what it was that was done.
And*p they come to Jesus, and see him that was possessed with the devil, and had the legion, sitting, and clothed, and in his right mind: and they were afraid.
And*p they that saw it told them how it befell to him that was possessed with the devil, and also concerning the swine.
And*p they began to pray him to depart out of their coasts.
And*p when he was come into the ship, he that had been possessed with the devil prayed him that he might be with him.

Howbeit*p Jesus suffered him not, but saith unto him, Go*r home*r to*r thy*r friends,*r and*r tell*r them*r how*r great*r things*r the*r Lord*r hath*r done*r for*r thee,*r and*r hath*r had*r compassion*r on*r thee.*r
And*p he departed, and began to publish in Decapolis how great things Jesus had done for him: and all men did marvel.
And*p when Jesus was passed over again by ship unto the other side, much people gathered unto him: and he was nigh unto the sea.
And,*p behold, there cometh one of the rulers of the synagogue, Jairus by name; and when he saw him, he fell at his feet,
And*p besought him greatly, saying, My little daughter lieth at the point of death: I pray thee, come and lay thy hands on her, that she may be healed; and she shall live.
And*p Jesus went with him; and much people followed him, and thronged him.
And*p a certain woman, which had an issue of blood twelve years,
And*p had suffered many things of many physicians, and had spent all that she had, and was nothing bettered, but rather grew worse,
When*p she had heard of Jesus, came in the press behind, and touched his garment.
For*p she said, If I may touch but his clothes, I shall be whole.
And*p straightway the fountain of her blood was dried up; and she felt in her body that she was healed of that plague.
And*p Jesus, immediately knowing in himself that virtue had gone out of him, turned him about in the press, and said, Who*r touched*r my*r clothes?*r
And*p his disciples said unto him, Thou seest the multitude thronging thee, and sayest thou, Who*r touched*r me?*r
And*p he looked round about to see her that had done this thing.
But*p the woman fearing and trembling, knowing what was done in her, came and fell down before him, and told him all the truth.
And*p he said unto her, Daughter,*r thy*r faith*r hath*r made*r thee*r whole;*r go*r in*r peace,*r and*r be*r whole*r of*r thy*r plague.*r
While*p he yet spake, there came from the ruler of the synagogue's house certain which said, Thy daughter is dead: why troublest thou the Master any further?
As*p soon as Jesus heard the word that was spoken, he saith unto the ruler of the synagogue, Be*r not*r afraid,*r only*r believe.*r
And*p he suffered no man to follow him, save Peter, and James, and John the brother of James.
And*p he cometh to the house of the ruler of the synagogue, and seeth the tumult, and them that wept and wailed greatly.
And*p when he was come in, he saith unto them, Why*r make*r ye*r this*r ado,*r and*r weep?*r the*r damsel*r is*r not*r dead,*r but*r sleepeth.*r
And*p they laughed him to scorn. But when he had put them all out, he taketh the father and the mother of the damsel, and them that were with him, and entereth in where the damsel was lying.
And*p he took the damsel by the hand, and said unto her, Talitha*r cumi;*r which is, being interpreted, Damsel,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r arise.*r
And*p straightway the damsel arose, and walked; for she was of the age of twelve years. And they were astonished with a great astonishment.
And*p he charged them straitly that no man should know it; and commanded that something should be given her to eat.
Mark 6
And*p he went out from thence, and came into his own country; and his disciples follow him.

And*p when the sabbath day was come, he began to teach in the synagogue: and many hearing him were astonished, saying, From whence hath this man these things? and what wisdom is this which is given unto him, that even such mighty works are wrought by his hands?
Is*p not this the carpenter, the son of Mary, the brother of James, and Joses, and of Judas, and Simon? and are not his sisters here with us? And they were offended at him.
But*p Jesus said unto them, A*r prophet*r is*r not*r without*r honour,*r but*r in*r his*r own*r country,*r and*r among*r his*r own*r kin,*r and*r in*r his*r own*r house.*r
And*p he could there do no mighty work, save that he laid his hands upon a few sick folk, and healed them.
And*p he marvelled because of their unbelief. And he went round about the villages, teaching.
And*p he called unto him the twelve, and began to send them forth by two and two; and gave them power over unclean spirits;
And*p commanded them that they should take nothing for their journey, save a staff only; no scrip, no bread, no money in their purse:
But*p be shod with sandals; and not put on two coats.
And*p he said unto them, In*r what*r place*r soever*r ye*r enter*r into*r an*r house,*r there*r abide*r till*r ye*r depart*r from*r that*r place.*r

And*rp whosoever*r shall*r not*r receive*r you,*r nor*r hear*r you,*r when*r ye*r depart*r thence,*r shake*r off*r the*r dust*r under*r your*r feet*r for*r a*r testimony*r against*r them.*r Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r It*r shall*r be*r more*r tolerable*r for*r Sodom*r and*r Gomorrha*r in*r the*r day*r of*r judgment,*r than*r for*r that*r city.*r
And*p they went out, and preached that men should repent.
And*p they cast out many devils, and anointed with oil many that were sick, and healed them.
And*p king Herod heard of him; (for his name was spread abroad:) and he said, That John the Baptist was risen from the dead, and therefore mighty works do shew forth themselves in him.
Others*p said, That it is Elias. And others said, That it is a prophet, or as one of the prophets.
But*p when Herod heard thereof, he said, It is John, whom I beheaded: he is risen from the dead.
For*p Herod himself had sent forth and laid hold upon John, and bound him in prison for Herodias' sake, his brother Philip's wife: for he had married her.
For*p John had said unto Herod, It is not lawful for thee to have thy brother's wife.
Therefore*p Herodias had a quarrel against him, and would have killed him; but she could not:
For*p Herod feared John, knowing that he was a just man and an holy, and observed him; and when he heard him, he did many things, and heard him gladly.
And*p when a convenient day was come, that Herod on his birthday made a supper to his lords, high captains, and chief estates of Galilee;
And*p when the daughter of the said Herodias came in, and danced, and pleased Herod and them that sat with him, the king said unto the damsel, Ask of me whatsoever thou wilt, and I will give it thee.
And*p he sware unto her, Whatsoever thou shalt ask of me, I will give it thee, unto the half of my kingdom.
And*p she went forth, and said unto her mother, What shall I ask? And she said, The head of John the Baptist.
And*p she came in straightway with haste unto the king, and asked, saying, I will that thou give me by and by in a charger the head of John the Baptist.
And*p the king was exceeding sorry; yet for his oath's sake, and for their sakes which sat with him, he would not reject her.
And*p immediately the king sent an executioner, and commanded his head to be brought: and he went and beheaded him in the prison,
And*p brought his head in a charger, and gave it to the damsel: and the damsel gave it to her mother.
And*p when his disciples heard of it, they came and took up his corpse, and laid it in a tomb.
And*p the apostles gathered themselves together unto Jesus, and told him all things, both what they had done, and what they had taught.
And*p he said unto them, Come*r ye*r yourselves*r apart*r into*r a*r desert*r place,*r and*r rest*r a*r while:*r for there were many coming and going, and they had no leisure so much as to eat.
And*p they departed into a desert place by ship privately.
And*p the people saw them departing, and many knew him, and ran afoot thither out of all cities, and outwent them, and came together unto him.
And*p Jesus, when he came out, saw much people, and was moved with compassion toward them, because they were as sheep not having a shepherd: and he began to teach them many things.
And*p when the day was now far spent, his disciples came unto him, and said, This is a desert place, and now the time is far passed:
Send*p them away, that they may go into the country round about, and into the villages, and buy themselves bread: for they have nothing to eat.
He*p answered and said unto them, Give*r ye*r them*r to*r eat.*r And they say unto him, Shall we go and buy two hundred pennyworth of bread, and give them to eat?
He*p saith unto them, How*r many*r loaves*r have*r ye?*r go*r and*r see.*r And when they knew, they say, Five, and two fishes.
And*p he commanded them to make all sit down by companies upon the green grass.
And*p they sat down in ranks, by hundreds, and by fifties.

And*p when he had taken the five loaves and the two fishes, he looked up to heaven, and blessed, and brake the loaves, and gave them to his disciples to set before them; and the two fishes divided he among them all.
And*p they did all eat, and were filled.
And*p they took up twelve baskets full of the fragments, and of the fishes.
And*p they that did eat of the loaves were about five thousand men.
And*p straightway he constrained his disciples to get into the ship, and to go to the other side before unto Bethsaida, while he sent away the people.
And*p when he had sent them away, he departed into a mountain to pray.
And*p when even was come, the ship was in the midst of the sea, and he alone on the land.
And*p he saw them toiling in rowing; for the wind was contrary unto them: and about the fourth watch of the night he cometh unto them, walking upon the sea, and would have passed by them.
But*p when they saw him walking upon the sea, they supposed it had been a spirit, and cried out:
For*p they all saw him, and were troubled. And immediately he talked with them, and saith unto them, Be*r of*r good*r cheer:*r it*r is*r I;*r be*r not*r afraid.*r
And*p he went up unto them into the ship; and the wind ceased: and they were sore amazed in themselves beyond measure, and wondered.
For*p they considered not the miracle of the loaves: for their heart was hardened.
And*p when they had passed over, they came into the land of Gennesaret, and drew to the shore.
And*p when they were come out of the ship, straightway they knew him,
And*p ran through that whole region round about, and began to carry about in beds those that were sick, where they heard he was.

And*p whithersoever he entered, into villages, or cities, or country, they laid the sick in the streets, and besought him that they might touch if it were but the border of his garment: and as many as touched him were made whole.
Mark 7
Then*p came together unto him the Pharisees, and certain of the scribes, which came from Jerusalem.
And*p when they saw some of his disciples eat bread with defiled, that is to say, with unwashen, hands, they found fault.
For*p the Pharisees, and all the Jews, except they wash their hands oft, eat not, holding the tradition of the elders.

And*p when they come from the market, except they wash, they eat not. And many other things there be, which they have received to hold, as the washing of cups, and pots, brasen vessels, and of tables.
Then*p the Pharisees and scribes asked him, Why walk not thy disciples according to the tradition of the elders, but eat bread with unwashen hands?

He*p answered and said unto them, Well*r hath*r Esaias*r prophesied*r of*r you*r hypocrites,*r as*r it*r is*r written,*r This*r people*r honoureth*r me*r with*r their*r lips,*r but*r their*r heart*r is*r far*r from*r me.*r
Howbeit*rp in*r vain*r do*r they*r worship*r me,*r teaching*r for*r doctrines*r the*r commandments*r of*r men.*r
For*rp laying*r aside*r the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r ye*r hold*r the*r tradition*r of*r men,*r as*r the*r washing*r of*r pots*r and*r cups:*r and*r many*r other*r such*r like*r things*r ye*r do.*r
And*p he said unto them, Full*r well*r ye*r reject*r the*r commandment*r of*r God,*r that*r ye*r may*r keep*r your*r own*r tradition.*r
For*rp Moses*r said,*r Honour*r thy*r father*r and*r thy*r mother;*r and,*r Whoso*r curseth*r father*r or*r mother,*r let*r him*r die*r the*r death:*r

But*rp ye*r say,*r If*r a*r man*r shall*r say*r to*r his*r father*r or*r mother,*r It*r is*r Corban,*r that*r is*r to*r say,*r a*r gift,*r by*r whatsoever*r thou*r mightest*r be*r profited*r by*r me;*r he*r shall*r be*r free.*r
And*rp ye*r suffer*r him*r no*r more*r to*r do*r ought*r for*r his*r father*r or*r his*r mother;*r
Making*rp the*r word*r of*r God*r of*r none*r effect*r through*r your*r tradition,*r which*r ye*r have*r delivered:*r and*r many*r such*r like*r things*r do*r ye.*r
And*p when he had called all the people unto him, he said unto them, Hearken*r unto*r me*r every*r one*r of*r you,*r and*r understand:*r

There*rp is*r nothing*r from*r without*r a*r man,*r that*r entering*r into*r him*r can*r defile*r him:*r but*r the*r things*r which*r come*r out*r of*r him,*r those*r are*r they*r that*r defile*r the*r man.*r
If*rp any*r man*r have*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.*r
And*p when he was entered into the house from the people, his disciples asked him concerning the parable.

And*p he saith unto them, Are*r ye*r so*r without*r understanding*r also?*r Do*r ye*r not*r perceive,*r that*r whatsoever*r thing*r from*r without*r entereth*r into*r the*r man,*r it*r cannot*r defile*r him;*r
Because*rp it*r entereth*r not*r into*r his*r heart,*r but*r into*r the*r belly,*r and*r goeth*r out*r into*r the*r draught,*r purging*r all*r meats?*r
And*p he said, That*r which*r cometh*r out*r of*r the*r man,*r that*r defileth*r the*r man.*r
For*rp from*r within,*r out*r of*r the*r heart*r of*r men,*r proceed*r evil*r thoughts,*r adulteries,*r fornications,*r murders,*r
Thefts,*rp covetousness,*r wickedness,*r deceit,*r lasciviousness,*r an*r evil*r eye,*r blasphemy,*r pride,*r foolishness:*r
All*rp these*r evil*r things*r come*r from*r within,*r and*r defile*r the*r man.*r
And*p from thence he arose, and went into the borders of Tyre and Sidon, and entered into an house, and would have no man know it: but he could not be hid.
For*p a certain woman, whose young daughter had an unclean spirit, heard of him, and came and fell at his feet:
The*p woman was a Greek, a Syrophenician by nation; and she besought him that he would cast forth the devil out of her daughter.
But*p Jesus said unto her, Let*r the*r children*r first*r be*r filled:*r for*r it*r is*r not*r meet*r to*r take*r the*r children's*r bread,*r and*r to*r cast*r it*r unto*r the*r dogs.*r
And*p she answered and said unto him, Yes, Lord: yet the dogs under the table eat of the children's crumbs.
And*p he said unto her, For*r this*r saying*r go*r thy*r way;*r the*r devil*r is*r gone*r out*r of*r thy*r daughter.*r
And*p when she was come to her house, she found the devil gone out, and her daughter laid upon the bed.
And*p again, departing from the coasts of Tyre and Sidon, he came unto the sea of Galilee, through the midst of the coasts of Decapolis.
And*p they bring unto him one that was deaf, and had an impediment in his speech; and they beseech him to put his hand upon him.
And*p he took him aside from the multitude, and put his fingers into his ears, and he spit, and touched his tongue;
And*p looking up to heaven, he sighed, and saith unto him, Ephphatha,*r that is, Be*r opened.*r
And*p straightway his ears were opened, and the string of his tongue was loosed, and he spake plain.
And*p he charged them that they should tell no man: but the more he charged them, so much the more a great deal they published it;
And*p were beyond measure astonished, saying, He hath done all things well: he maketh both the deaf to hear, and the dumb to speak.
Mark 8
In*p those days the multitude being very great, and having nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples unto him, and saith unto them,
I*rp have*r compassion*r on*r the*r multitude,*r because*r they*r have*r now*r been*r with*r me*r three*r days,*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat:*r
And*rp if*r I*r send*r them*r away*r fasting*r to*r their*r own*r houses,*r they*r will*r faint*r by*r the*r way:*r for*r divers*r of*r them*r came*r from*r far.*r
And*p his disciples answered him, From whence can a man satisfy these men with bread here in the wilderness?
And*p he asked them, How*r many*r loaves*r have*r ye?*r And they said, Seven.

And*p he commanded the people to sit down on the ground: and he took the seven loaves, and gave thanks, and brake, and gave to his disciples to set before them; and they did set them before the people.
And*p they had a few small fishes: and he blessed, and commanded to set them also before them.
So*p they did eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets.
And*p they that had eaten were about four thousand: and he sent them away.
And*p straightway he entered into a ship with his disciples, and came into the parts of Dalmanutha.
And*p the Pharisees came forth, and began to question with him, seeking of him a sign from heaven, tempting him.

And*p he sighed deeply in his spirit, and saith, Why*r doth*r this*r generation*r seek*r after*r a*r sign?*r verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r There*r shall*r no*r sign*r be*r given*r unto*r this*r generation.*r
And*p he left them, and entering into the ship again departed to the other side.
Now*p the disciples had forgotten to take bread, neither had they in the ship with them more than one loaf.
And*p he charged them, saying, Take*r heed,*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees,*r and*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r Herod.*r
And*p they reasoned among themselves, saying, It is because we have no bread.

And*p when Jesus knew it, he saith unto them, Why*r reason*r ye,*r because*r ye*r have*r no*r bread?*r perceive*r ye*r not*r yet,*r neither*r understand?*r have*r ye*r your*r heart*r yet*r hardened?*r
Having*rp eyes,*r see*r ye*r not?*r and*r having*r ears,*r hear*r ye*r not?*r and*r do*r ye*r not*r remember?*r
When*rp I*r brake*r the*r five*r loaves*r among*r five*r thousand,*r how*r many*r baskets*r full*r of*r fragments*r took*r ye*r up?*r They say unto him, Twelve.
And*rp when*r the*r seven*r among*r four*r thousand,*r how*r many*r baskets*r full*r of*r fragments*r took*r ye*r up?*r And they said, Seven.
And*p he said unto them, How*r is*r it*r that*r ye*r do*r not*r understand?*r
And*p he cometh to Bethsaida; and they bring a blind man unto him, and besought him to touch him.
And*p he took the blind man by the hand, and led him out of the town; and when he had spit on his eyes, and put his hands upon him, he asked him if he saw ought.
And*p he looked up, and said, I see men as trees, walking.
After*p that he put his hands again upon his eyes, and made him look up: and he was restored, and saw every man clearly.
And*p he sent him away to his house, saying, Neither*r go*r into*r the*r town,*r nor*r tell*r it*r to*r any*r in*r the*r town.*r
And*p Jesus went out, and his disciples, into the towns of Caesarea Philippi: and by the way he asked his disciples, saying unto them, Whom*r do*r men*r say*r that*r I*r am?*r
And*p they answered, John the Baptist: but some say, Elias; and others, One of the prophets.
And*p he saith unto them, But*r whom*r say*r ye*r that*r I*r am?*r And Peter answereth and saith unto him, Thou art the Christ.
And*p he charged them that they should tell no man of him.
And*p he began to teach them, that the Son of man must suffer many things, and be rejected of the elders, and of the chief priests, and scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
And*p he spake that saying openly. And Peter took him, and began to rebuke him.

But*p when he had turned about and looked on his disciples, he rebuked Peter, saying, Get*r thee*r behind*r me,*r Satan:*r for*r thou*r savourest*r not*r the*r things*r that*r be*r of*r God,*r but*r the*r things*r that*r be*r of*r men.*r

And*p when he had called the people unto him with his disciples also, he said unto them, Whosoever*r will*r come*r after*r me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross,*r and*r follow*r me.*r
For*rp whosoever*r will*r save*r his*r life*r shall*r lose*r it;*r but*r whosoever*r shall*r lose*r his*r life*r for*r my*r sake*r and*r the*r gospel's,*r the*r same*r shall*r save*r it.*r
For*rp what*r shall*r it*r profit*r a*r man,*r if*r he*r shall*r gain*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r lose*r his*r own*r soul?*r
Or*rp what*r shall*r a*r man*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r soul?*r

Whosoever*rp therefore*r shall*r be*r ashamed*r of*r me*r and*r of*r my*r words*r in*r this*r adulterous*r and*r sinful*r generation;*r of*r him*r also*r shall*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r be*r ashamed,*r when*r he*r cometh*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r his*r Father*r with*r the*r holy*r angels.*r
Mark 9

And*p he said unto them, Verily*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r there*r be*r some*r of*r them*r that*r stand*r here,*r which*r shall*r not*r taste*r of*r death,*r till*r they*r have*r seen*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r come*r with*r power.*r
And*p after six days Jesus taketh with him Peter, and James, and John, and leadeth them up into an high mountain apart by themselves: and he was transfigured before them.
And*p his raiment became shining, exceeding white as snow; so as no fuller on earth can white them.
And*p there appeared unto them Elias with Moses: and they were talking with Jesus.
And*p Peter answered and said to Jesus, Master, it is good for us to be here: and let us make three tabernacles; one for thee, and one for Moses, and one for Elias.
For*p he wist not what to say; for they were sore afraid.
And*p there was a cloud that overshadowed them: and a voice came out of the cloud, saying, This is my beloved Son: hear him.
And*p suddenly, when they had looked round about, they saw no man any more, save Jesus only with themselves.
And*p as they came down from the mountain, he charged them that they should tell no man what things they had seen, till the Son of man were risen from the dead.
And*p they kept that saying with themselves, questioning one with another what the rising from the dead should mean.
And*p they asked him, saying, Why say the scribes that Elias must first come?

And*p he answered and told them, Elias*r verily*r cometh*r first,*r and*r restoreth*r all*r things;*r and*r how*r it*r is*r written*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r man,*r that*r he*r must*r suffer*r many*r things,*r and*r be*r set*r at*r nought.*r
But*rp I*r say*r unto*r you,*r That*r Elias*r is*r indeed*r come,*r and*r they*r have*r done*r unto*r him*r whatsoever*r they*r listed,*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r him.*r
And*p when he came to his disciples, he saw a great multitude about them, and the scribes questioning with them.
And*p straightway all the people, when they beheld him, were greatly amazed, and running to him saluted him.
And*p he asked the scribes, What*r question*r ye*r with*r them?*r
And*p one of the multitude answered and said, Master, I have brought unto thee my son, which hath a dumb spirit;
And*p wheresoever he taketh him, he teareth him: and he foameth, and gnasheth with his teeth, and pineth away: and I spake to thy disciples that they should cast him out; and they could not.
He*p answereth him, and saith, O*r faithless*r generation,*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r be*r with*r you?*r how*r long*r shall*r I*r suffer*r you?*r bring*r him*r unto*r me.*r
And*p they brought him unto him: and when he saw him, straightway the spirit tare him; and he fell on the ground, and wallowed foaming.
And*p he asked his father, How*r long*r is*r it*r ago*r since*r this*r came*r unto*r him?*r And he said, Of a child.
And*p ofttimes it hath cast him into the fire, and into the waters, to destroy him: but if thou canst do any thing, have compassion on us, and help us.
Jesus*p said unto him, If*r thou*r canst*r believe,*r all*r things*r are*r possible*r to*r him*r that*r believeth.*r
And*p straightway the father of the child cried out, and said with tears, Lord, I believe; help thou mine unbelief.

When*p Jesus saw that the people came running together, he rebuked the foul spirit, saying unto him, Thou*r dumb*r and*r deaf*r spirit,*r I*r charge*r thee,*r come*r out*r of*r him,*r and*r enter*r no*r more*r into*r him.*r
And*p the spirit cried, and rent him sore, and came out of him: and he was as one dead; insomuch that many said, He is dead.
But*p Jesus took him by the hand, and lifted him up; and he arose.
And*p when he was come into the house, his disciples asked him privately, Why could not we cast him out?
And*p he said unto them, This*r kind*r can*r come*r forth*r by*r nothing,*r but*r by*r prayer*r and*r fasting.*r
And*p they departed thence, and passed through Galilee; and he would not that any man should know it.

For*p he taught his disciples, and said unto them, The*r Son*r of*r man*r is*r delivered*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r men,*r and*r they*r shall*r kill*r him;*r and*r after*r that*r he*r is*r killed,*r he*r shall*r rise*r the*r third*r day.*r
But*p they understood not that saying, and were afraid to ask him.
And*p he came to Capernaum: and being in the house he asked them, What*r was*r it*r that*r ye*r disputed*r among*r yourselves*r by*r the*r way?*r
But*p they held their peace: for by the way they had disputed among themselves, who should be the greatest.
And*p he sat down, and called the twelve, and saith unto them, If*r any*r man*r desire*r to*r be*r first,*r the*r same*r shall*r be*r last*r of*r all,*r and*r servant*r of*r all.*r
And*p he took a child, and set him in the midst of them: and when he had taken him in his arms, he said unto them,
Whosoever*rp shall*r receive*r one*r of*r such*r children*r in*r my*r name,*r receiveth*r me:*r and*r whosoever*r shall*r receive*r me,*r receiveth*r not*r me,*r but*r him*r that*r sent*r me.*r
And*p John answered him, saying, Master, we saw one casting out devils in thy name, and he followeth not us: and we forbad him, because he followeth not us.
But*p Jesus said, Forbid*r him*r not:*r for*r there*r is*r no*r man*r which*r shall*r do*r a*r miracle*r in*r my*r name,*r that*r can*r lightly*r speak*r evil*r of*r me.*r
For*rp he*r that*r is*r not*r against*r us*r is*r on*r our*r part.*r
